content: Black Book of Peterborough or Liber Niger

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 39v) Þis synd þa madmas þe Adeluuold bisceop sealde into þam mynstre þe is Medeshamstede gehatan

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 40v) Þa Ætheluuine aldorman ˥ Ealdulf biscop sealdan Æthestane ˥ Alfwolde for Iacesle ˥ Faresheued þone latostan penig for þan lande into Burch. þa weron þer festermen. Frana... ˥ Sumerlyda preost.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 46v) In nomine patris et filii et spiritus sancti. Ceolred abbod ˥ ða higan on Medeshamstede sellað Wulfrede ðet land

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 46v) Ic Ceolred abbod þas ure selene mid Cristes rode tacne trymme ˥ festnie.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English and Latin

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 47r) Þis synd þa festermen þe Osferð swade beard funde. Adeluuolde biscop. ˥ Eadulfe abbod ˥ Sumerlydan preoste

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 49r).. ˥ on his wedde gesealde þet land æt Wermingtune æfter his dæg into sancte PETRE for his saule on hyra gewytnesse.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 50r) Þis sint þa landgemæro to Undelan

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 50r) ˥ þat land on beringa feld swa swa hit is mid land ge mærum. liggæð into Vndelan.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 50v) Þis is se feorewearde þe Vlf ˥ Madselin his gebedda worhtan wið ˥ wið sancte PETER. þa hig to Ierusalem ferdon.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 51r) ˥ Lindbeorhge habban mine cnihtas gif ic ham ne cume. ˥ þæt land æt Lohtune þæt heo hafað þæt erinne [sic]. into Þornege.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 52r) Ðis is into Suttenes hundred, þat is an hundred hida swa hit wæs on Æduuardes deige kynges

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 54v) ˥ þerof is wered I ˥ IL hide ˥ III syðe twenti hide inland ˥ VIIII ˥ XL hide weste

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 54v) Her sutelað on þyssum gewrite þet Aþelwold bisceop ˥ Wulfstan Uccea hwyrfdon landa.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 55r) ˥ Wulstan Uccea his sunu hit sealde eft Adeluuolde bisceope. swa swa hit her bufan sægð.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

objectDesc.extent:
253 mm x 170 mm (dimensions of all - size of leaves).
194 mm x 107 mm (dimensions of all - size of written space).

binding: Nineteenth-century binding of brown leather, blind-tooled. Dark green slipcase (National Archives).
accompanying: On fol. 2v is the note 'Iste Liber vocatur Niger Liber anglice The black bowke', s. xvi.

history.provenance: Remained in Peterborough until at least s. xvi. At some point the manuscript was owned by Sir Robert Wingfield of Upton (d. 1636). Wingfield also owned two Peterborough registers: London, BL, Cotton Vespasian E. xxi, fols 45- 106 and London, BL, Cotton Vespasian E. xxii (Robinson 2003, p. 69).
history.acquisition: Presented to the Society of Antiquaries in 1778 by Brownlow, 9th Earl of Exeter.

admin: Manuscript described by Elaine Treharne with the assistance of Hollie Morgan and George Younge (2010; 2013).
